ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned the fundamentals of Italian and how to converse with limited knowledge/vocabulary.
I learned the basics of the Italian language through an elementary course.

Throughout Italian 1, I learned basic conversational skills in Italian, ranging from present tense to three different structures of past tense. I also learned many cultural elements of the Italian language.
I learned some basic Italian
It was incredible how fast we learned Italian. I feel quite confident in elementary stuff after only one semester. Very well taught!
basic conversational Italian
I learned Italian!
I learned a thorough overview of very basic Italian words that would be necessary for a basic comprehension of the language. We learned many relevant terms!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The class I was in was a very good group of students. We got along with our teacher well and I think that made the course significantly more entertaining and improved learning.

Although I understand that this course requires an immense amount of practice and memorization, I suggest that more engaging activities be integrated into the content of the course. This would help individuals, such as myself, to learn content more easily and allow for more creative connections to aid in memorization.

Roberto Ferrini was an incredible teacher that made this class extremely fun and engaging. I always felt very involved in the lesson, and having class everyday definitely hammered the language into my head. I dont believe there are any inherent weaknesses in this class, I thought it was wonderful, and I am excited to continue Italian with Roberto next semester.
I think more student speaking would be good
Honestly all great. Loved the chill atmosphere and fun time we had in class, while still learning a ton.

strengths- very relaxed class atmosphere, made it easy to participate and be engaged during class; I learned a lot of Italian just in one semester
weakness- the textbook is required to participate in the class and is extremely expensive

The course is extremely engaging and you learn a lot in a short period of time. I think this applies to all L1 classes but the class was fairly self-taught and then we review in class. While the class review was very helpful, and while going through the information beforehand was also helpful, it would be useful to have more concepts be taught during class time.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. I would recommend to have Roberto Ferrini as a teacher too because he really tries to get you to understand the material.

I would recommend this course to a student that is trying to fulfill their language requirement because although it was quite difficult, it was less difficult than other language courses. I think the between the English and Italian languages also helped me as an English speaker.

I would absolutely recommend this course to another student! Roberto was a phenomenal teacher, and I always tell my friends who are considering Italian to take his class. Italian is such a wonderful language to learn, and Roberto makes doing so fun! It was definitely one of my favorite classes this semester!
Yes, please take it! If you want to learn the language, I cant imagine you can do better than Italian at Yale. Awesome department.
Yes; it was very fun and I learned a lot
yes!
Yes! Italian is a fun language to learn.
